question: What are the Ahadith regarding recitation of Surah Kahf? Is there any special significance for reading it on Friday?
answer:
QUESTION
ANSWER


Share:
Regarding the recitation of Surah Kahf, both narrations of reciting it from%0D%0Amemory and also from the Quraan itself exist in the hadith.%0D%0Aa) ibn Mardawaih reports from ibn Umar marfooan: He who recites Surah Kahf%0D%0Aon the day of Jumuah, nur (light) will be spread out for him from below his%0D%0Afeet till the sky, it will shine for him till the Day of Judgement and hsi%0D%0Asins between the two Jumuahs will be forgiven for him.%0D%0A%0D%0AIn Tafseere Roohul Ma'ani vol.8 pg. 288, under the tafseer of Surah Kahf,%0D%0Athere are three Ahaadith which support the recitation of Surh Kahf from the%0D%0AQuraan and there also appear a few narrations on reciting from memory.%0D%0A%0D%0A3) Surah Kahf can be recited on the night of Jumuah (Thursday night) or on%0D%0Athe Day of Jumuah. Narrations regarding its recitaiton at both times are%0D%0Afound in the treasure of Ahaadith.%0D%0A%0D%0Aa) ibn Mardawaih reports from Abdullah ibn Mughaffal marfooan: The home in%0D%0Awhich Surah Kahf is recited, shaitaan does not enter that house on that%0D%0Aspecific night. (Roohul Ma'ani, vol. 8, pg. 289).%0D%0A%0D%0AMany Ulama are of the opinion that it is sunnat to recite Surah Kahf on the%0D%0ADay of Jumuah and on the same token, many are of the view that is sunnat to%0D%0Arecite it on the Night of Jumuah and they also state that it will be%0D%0Acommendable to read it at both times. (Roohul Ma'ani, vol.8 pg. 289).%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai%0D%0A
